docs.lead_paragraph: I credit President Trump — not that he seems any more evolved than the first earthworms now appearing in the cold soil of my garden.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Russian president’s continuing denial of government involvement in athlete doping casts disgrace and doubt on the fairness of the Olympic Games.

docs.lead_paragraph: Israeli rocker Aviv Geffen broke into "The Hope Song," a signature hit he wrote after the assassination of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin that is often referred to as the Israeli version of John Lennon's "Imagine."

docs.lead_paragraph: Two former Utah attorneys general who avoided convictions in a bribery case that was one of the highest-profile scandals in state history said Friday they were naive and made missteps but that the justice system got it right in not convicting them.

headline.main: Ex-Attorneys General Say They Were Naive, but Innocent
headline.print_headline: Ex-Attorneys General Say They Were Naive, but Innocent

docs.lead_paragraph: Bangladeshi police have arrested the head of an Islamist militant group accused of inspiring followers to kill foreigners, the chief of the counter-terrorism unit said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: With frequent suicide bombings and assaults on Somalia's hotels and military targets, the Islamic extremist group al-Shabab has proved more resilient than expected, leading President Donald Trump's administration to pursue wider military involvement here as current strategies, including drone attacks, are not enough, security experts say.

headline.main: US Steps Up in Somalia as Al-Shabab Proves a Stubborn Foe
headline.print_headline: US Steps Up in Somalia as Al-Shabab Proves a Stubborn Foe

docs.lead_paragraph: Middlesbrough manager Aitor Karanka is not worried about the possibility of losing his job and the Spaniard is fully focussed on keeping his struggling team in the Premier League.
